data.title: Inside: - The Bowling News
data.text: Our 54th Year VOL. 54, NO. 5 www.TheBowlingNews.net FEBRUARY 4, 2010 Inside: Westcreek teams stuck on number Two teams in the Classic High Pot league got stuck on a number. And, they got stuck five times.. Page 4 West captures Ebonite SASBA West won his 12th SASBA title at the tournament held Jan. 23-24 at University Lanes in Denton. Page 4 International Bowling Campus Grand Opening Pictures and comments. Page 10 Kelly Kulick exclusive interview and national commentary Page 12 Features Picking Up Corner Pins By Jim Woodruff Page 2 Honor Roll Page 3 Up Your Average By Susie Minshew Page 7 Tomorrow’s Stars Page 14-15 Sponsored by Classic Products Lane Laughter Page 16 TV Log Page 16 Off the Sheet By Clint Dacy Page 16 Wright in the Heart of Texas By Don Wright Page 21 PRESORTED STD U.S. POSTAGE PAID ARLINGTON, TX PERMIT NO. 419 Bowling Campus takes seat among elite in Arlington By Jim Woodruff Bowling, with its forces united like never before, has moved into the neighborhood of some of the world’s most exclusive sports franchises. Like Cowboys Stadium, Arlington Stadium and Six Flags. You can hit a nine-iron into the Six Flags area. The Grand Opening of the International Bowling Campus was held Jan. 25, and it was one of the game’s finest moments ever. As emcee for the opening, Ron Williams TCBA team shines On Sept. 21, 2008 at Jupiter Lanes, the Ron Williams Pro Shop TCBA team rolled a team game of 1256 which earned them first-place for the highest five-Women Team Game in the nation last year (award year Aug. 2008-Aug. 2009). They received the National Team Recognition award on Jan. 24. Continued on Page 21 Scott Murray, said, “It will blow you away.” As Bill Supper, International Bowling Museum and Hall of History-making Kulick mows ’em down LAS VEGAS, NV — Sports history was made Jan. 24 when Kelly Kulick of Union, NJ, won the 45th Professional Bowlers Association Tournament of Champions at Red Rock Lanes, becoming the first woman to win a Lumber Liquidators PBA Tour tournament. She defeated 2007-08 PBA Player of the Year Chris Barnes 265-195 in the championship match to win a $40,000 first prize in PBA’s signature event, plus a two-year exemption on the PBA Tour. “It’s been a dream of mine to win a PBA Tour event but I couldn’t have imagined it would have come in the Tournament of Champions,” said the 32-year-old right-hander. “It may have looked easy but Continued on Page 19 The gang’s all there for Campus’ opening. Fame executive, summed it up,” This is a historic event.” Some 1,000 fans overflowed the outdoors event. They came Kelly Kulick From left, Sandi Charles, Genie Franklin, Leisha Murr, Kiyoko McDonald and Lisa Wasson. � Exclusive: CDB interview with Kelly Kulic Page 12 from across the country and included many of the game’s leading names. Continued on Page 22 Allen wins NABI title in Richardson Three-year NABI member Ronnie Allen earned his first title Jan. 23-24 at AMF Richardson. Allen rolled a 213 highgame to eliminate the other four in the top five finals of the shootout. Allen earned $847 for the win. Other top five cashers were: 2. Randy Price (207) $423; 3. Ted Garner (194) $154; 4. Torris Jackson (187) $154; 5. Ed Williams (170) $90. Continued on Page 20 Ronnie Allen
